Text.Value: If it helps, she won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

Text.Value: I hope it doesn't come to that but... thank you. Here.

EditorData.AnimationTags: give a vial of poison - LOD, Needs seated ProduceInventory and TakeInventory. ~CDavis

Text.Value: Leave.
I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [REUSE] For [Player] you can use first part of SCENE_GOB_GoblinPriest_Chapel_DrinkPotion
EditorData.NodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

Text.Value: Swear it.
All right! Master Halsin thought the tadpole was dormant, so you have some time. Perhaps it's only fair I let you use it.
The grove is in terrible danger - cure me and I'll tell your leader how to save it.
Could be, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Sel√ªne, and I've no idea why.

RuleGroup.RuleString: REALLY_GALE or SORCERER or WARLOCK or WIZARD

Text.Value: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!
I think so. I hope so. I've sent birds to find him, but they can't get close without goblins trying to shoot them down.
Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the vial. Remember your oath.
I hope your friend sees sense soon. They don't have much time left.
It sounds like you're making a lot of assumptions that could kill me.
Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!
Then we've nothing more to talk about.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player refuses to take your poison, you refuse to let them out.

Text.Value: By my sacred oath, I swear it.
Just tell me if there's a cure or not.
Because you should all be changing - there should be a small army of mind flayers out there! But you're not. Weird powers aside, you seem perfectly normal.
All right, I'll find Halsin.
I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know she'll take the wyvern poison if she starts to change.
I hope your friend sees sense soon. He doesn't have much time left.

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

Text.Value: The way I see it, you have two options: Halsin or that wyvern poison.
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.

EditorData.AnimationTags: get up ready to fight, [Keyframe] Merge SeatedSq_ToStandL and Combat Idle animations into SeatedSq_ToCombatIdle animation. ~CDavis
EditorData.NodeContext: You're about to attack the player with a poisoned thorn

Text.Value: For one, that thing in your head is like nothing we've ever seen from mind flayers.
So you think it's only a matter of time?

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (only if wyvern poison was given)

Text.Value: Try to recall the tenets of her order - no druid could support this!
I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know he'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!
You're sure he can cure me?
I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know he'll take the wyvern poison if he starts to change.
Leave.
You can't cure what you don't understand. And as much as I know about mind flayers, I can't make heads nor tails of this.
Well, not to worry. Have a read of that book - Flora of the Dalelands. There's a recipe for your antidote in there. It won't do anything for what's in your skull, though.

EditorData.logicalname: Fallback, no antidote- Skip if already cured

Text.Value: Otherwise you'll need to end things yourself, before the transformation really takes hold.

EditorData.logicalname: If no wyvern poison was given

Text.Value: Master Halsin and I were tracking them, studying them, trying to figure out what the hells was going on.
I don't envy your choice, truly. But this is the hand fate's dealt you.
The door's locked. Neither of us are leaving until this is done.
But I know this for sure: Master Halsin is the only one close to understanding these things. He's your best bet to survive.
Recite her order's druidic law - this can't be allowed!
It's one of their worms, for sure, but this one gives you powers - telepathic connections. And it doesn't turn you into one of them.
All I can say for sure is they all went to the old temple of Sel√ªne and Master Halsin didn't make it back.
It might be suicide either way. Trust me, you do not want to become one of those monsters.
You must've learned something from studying them.
Here, take this. It'll stop the poison, but I can't do anything for that wriggler in your head.

EditorData.logicalname: Give antidote - Skip if already cured

Text.Value: And? Will you swear you'd die before you turn?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: She doesn't have the wyvern poison in her inventory, player pickpocketed it already

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (If no wyvern poison was given)

Text.Value: Attack.
Eventually? That gives me time to find a cure.
I know you're angry, but how many people would die if you changed? I can't take that risk.
You think he's still alive?
I wish I could tell you what happened out there, but those adventurers were the only witnesses. And they're long gone.
Thank you. I truly hope it doesn't come to that.
Gods above - why didn't you say so?

EditorData.NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

Text.Value: I know where Halsin is! Give me the antidote or he'll die too!
Yes? Is there anything I can do?
Thank you. It would mean everything to the grove. To me.
Now, I've an antidote - um... where is the bloody thing?
That's... good news?
Leave.
I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. And if my birds can't get close, what chance do I have?
There's no stopping you, is there?
I already know where to find him: the worg pens of the goblin camp.
I'll never swear to that.
I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.
Attack.
But first - swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Firm tone. 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

Text.Value: Leave.
I hope your friend sees sense soon. She doesn't have much time left.

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

Text.Value: But first - this is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.

EditorData.NodeContext: Firm tone. Holds out vial of poison

Text.Value: What do you mean 'should' be changing?
The thing is, I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. None of us can even get close.
What do you want me to do?
And? Will you swear you'll take the poison?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: She has the wyvern poison in her inventory

Text.Value: I swear, Nettie.
Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the oath you swore.
Not yet, anyhow.
I can't make any promises. This is like nothing we've seen before.
Have you lost your mind? No!
Hard to say, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Sel√ªne, and I've no idea why.
Please, you have to bring him back to us. For your own sake as much as ours.
Otherwise, that vial's your only option.

EditorData.logicalname: only if wyvern poison was given

Text.Value: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.
It's been days. If I were going to turn, it would've happened by now.
You, though? You're one of them - technically speaking, I mean. They might not kill someone carrying their parasite.
Swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

Text.Value: That sounds like suicide. I won't do it.
I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know they'll take the wyvern poison if they start to change.
I wish I could tell you more, but only those adventurers know what happened out there.
It doesn't matter if you're Silvanus himself come to walk among us - infected is infected.
If it helps, they won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give them.
You're alive? There's no way I'm stopping you, is there?

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprised "you're alive?"  but then sadly resigned. She didn't want to let you go.
EditorData.logicalname: Edge-case: poisoned, died and raised from dead before persuasion

Text.Value: The thing in your skull, though? It's different to anything in our records.
The way I see it, you have two options: Halsin or death - whatever form it takes.
Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!
If it helps, he won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

Text.Value: Fine, just give it to me.
If you can find Halsin and get him out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?
You said you were tracking other victims. Did they change?
We can both see I have no symptoms - I'm not about to change!
I wouldn't be so sure. There's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Sel√ªne, and I've no idea why.
You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.
So? Go and get him.
Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!
I don't want to hurt you, but I can't let you live. You're too dangerous.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player's cured themselves and may escape from the room you've locked them in

Text.Value: Aside from the obvious.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little sadly. She wants to save you, but feels that she morally can't.

Text.Value: When Master Halsin heard the adventurers were heading that way, he saw a chance to get answers. Joined on the spot.
Whatever he found there, he didn't make it back.
I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know she'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know they'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
This is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.
I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.
I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [REUSE] For [Player] you can use first part of SCENE_GOB_GoblinPriest_Chapel_DrinkPotion
EditorData.NodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

Text.Value: Mind flayers reproduce by infecting someone with their parasite. Seven gruesome days later, the victim transforms and a new mind flayer is born.
Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!
You can't do this - I'm on a secret mission. Everything depends on it.
Excellent news! All the power, none of the tentacles.
But of course, the choice is yours. I just hope you find a cure out there.
And here's the antidote. Do not mix those two up.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hands you the antidote. 'Don't mix them up' refers to the antidote and the poison
EditorData.logicalname: Give antidote - Skip if already cured

Text.Value: Hells' teeth. All right. I'll tell you where the antidote is, but there's a condition.

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises that if she acts quickly, she can save her mentor.

Synopsis: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.
